inn1.comm: Bradshaw off to a poor start with a ball which starts wide and gets wider
much the same ball but it starts on a better line and Smith watches it go by
good line, Smith blocks on the back foot
more leg-side and Smith stumbles - and misses - attempting to flick it off his pads
pitched right up and driven to short extra cover
Smith shapes to flick to leg but again misses and it smacks him on the pads. No appeal, possibly a small snick
outside of stump and left. A good end to a good over once the first-ball wide was out of the way
a bit too short and not that fast, seamed back in and flicked neatly to long leg
he's loose! That was almost 90mph and speared in at the leg stump, and Smith could only flick to short midwicket
again leg side, Smith moved slightly out the way and it rocketed through at waist height  to Baugh
straight and Smith could only block
soft hands took the pace off the ball and Smith steered it into the gap between mid on and midwicket
Bosman right in line to a straight one
Bosman cut in half by one that jagged back and missed his off stump by a couple of inches. He appeared to be leaving it and only brought his bat down once the ball was past him
neatly turned into the gap on the leg side
Smith circumspectly forward and steers to point
a touch more aggression in the shot but driven to mid off
Smith takes a big step to meet the ball but can only pat it to mid on
another big stride from Smith, hit on the rise between cover and extra cover and the ball just beats the fielders' hot pursuit
nice stop by Chanderpaul at short midwicket
outside off stump, little footwork and a wild swish from Bosman. That one topped 90mph
Bosman turned a bit square, he played that with little conviction and it squirted backward of point. His technique looks a bit suspect
pushed into the covers for a tip-and-run single
that one took off and Bosman half-played, half-left as it shot through to the keeper
overpitched and nicely turned off his leg through midwicket
short and Bosman ducks as it passes harmlessly over him
lovely delivery, beats Smith outside his off stump and leaves him groping at air
a bad ball follows a good one, overpitched and flicked into the leg side
again Bradshaw overpitches and strays down the leg - it's a Smith strength in that area and he cracks it to the right of midwicket
a better line but again too full and the end result is the same. That shot was 90% timing and 10% power
Bradshaw is not going to get near leg stump again in this over!
outside off and Smith steers it to third man. A very productive over for South Africa
what a beauty. An inswinger right through Smith, clipping his pads on the way through to his off stump. He was caught in his crease there
the fastest ball of the day - 91.7mph - to greet Kallis and he jabs down in time and runs it through third slip - all along the ground for a single
wild swing from Bosman to one wide of off stump
another weak shot to a ball leaving him outside off stump
beaten all ends up outside off stump. Again his foot movement was limited ... he move sback and across but that's about it
pushed into the covers, but he plays the ball well away from his body
plopped into the leg side, Bosman spotted mid on was a bit deep and called for the single ... Kallis slow to respond, although he did in the end
wide and swung across the right hander
better line and Kallis calmly pats it back to mid off
left alone and close to being another wide
big, bold step forward and solidly blocked
fuller length and Kallis gets everything behind it
another good line and Kallis again plays the waiting game
Bosman able to leave it
Taylor strays down the leg and Bosman moves across to turn to long leg
half volley on leg stump, exquisitely flicked through midwicket, no power but perfect timing and he didn't even bother to start running. That was four all the way
good response from Taylor

bat and pad jammed together, an appeal came from behind the stumps and Taylor followed belatedly. His tardiness probably influenced the decision as replays show that the ball hit the pad first and was going on to smack leg stump
a tight delivery to end a mixed over
Bradshaw finds a better line. He's been wayward so far
a bit shorter and Bosman too cramped to do anything with it
that gave Bosman the width to play a shot but he failed to time it at all and his attempted cut trickled into the covers
half forward and he played and missed
again Bosman was glued to the crease and was well beaten outside the off stump. That died on Baugh as he had to dive to take it low down
angled down to third man. West Indies will be happy to let Bosman keep the strike
Kallis looked to make room but Bradshaw cramped him
"That's out"  we all shriek. Bosman caught in the crease playing across the line and it hit him right in front. Simon Taufel disagrees
Taylor replies with a bouncer
another bouncer from Taylor who is clearly riled by Taufel's decision
that cut Bosman to ribbons. He looks leaden footed and out of his depth against this
Taylor cuts it back in and Bosman jabs down in time
wide and left alone. West Indies will be happy to keep Bosman in as he doesn't look capable of scoring quickly and his technique is frankly flawed. But, to his credit, he's still battling
flogged off the back foot, but not timed and picked up in the covers
good delivery, extra bounce on a good length and Kallis is surprised
steps inside the line and whips through the leg-side. Good use of the crease
stand and deliver stuff! Width and clobbered, over the infield and down to the point boundary. Cracking shot, and Bradshaw continues to toil
better from Bradshaw, tighter to the stumps, and pushed back down the pitch
handsome drive, lovely high elbow and all the trimmings. But mid-off fields. Kallis is looking in ominous touch today
but having said that, beat the field he does! Good stride onto the front foot, and caressed through the gap
strays onto leg stump, and whipped behind square for one. Bosman is looking more confident at last
good length on off stump, attractive-looking drive from Kallis, but easily fielded in the covers
rocks onto the back foot this time, and fielded again in the covers. He's middling everything, but can't pick the gaps as yet
more of the same. This one really should have been put away - short and wide. But perhaps Kallis tried to be too classical with his back-foot drive. He should have wellied it!
biff! That's the way to greet a new bowler! Too full first-up, and hammered over the infield and away to midwicket. Well done him
on the pads, and can't whip it away
similar delivery, similar result
fuller length - much better length - and Bosman drops his wrists off the back foot and guides to gully
lovely strike, really dancing at the crease for that delivery. Got his legs out of the way to a full-length leg-stump delivery, and well timed through the covers. Second boundary of the over!
and a dot to finish
good length to start, no great pace
interesting shuffle at the crease, and meets the ball well outside off stump
well, well! That was just tonked straight back over his head. Absolutely no standing on ceremony in that shot!
driven again, but not timed. Kallis is bristling with aggression today
beaten - a bit of a yelp from the keeper but no alarms
full length, and driven out to mid-on
leg-side and rightly called by the umpire
cross-batted smear. The cameraman panned out dramatically, thinking the ball was sailing into the stands, but it just dribbled out to the covers
fuller length, on the back foot again and steering to gully
good length and defended
text-book defensive shot. Looking to come forward, late adjustment, bat and pad right together. Beautiful stuff
aggressive intent this time, but again, he can't beat the field. Picked up in the covers
full-blooded flog of a cover-drive, but straight to the fielder AGAIN! It's lucky Kallis is known for his sang-froid, or else he might be getting frustrated here
dabbed behind square on the off-side, too much width
lovely caressed drive from Kallis, but the old man Lara leaps dramatically to his right to intercept. He's fully aware of Kallis's inability to beat the field at the moment
bit of a lazy swat this time from Kallis. Front elbow not as high as usual
too much width again, and Kallis accepts the offering with a dab to third man
turns a leg-side delivery out to midwicket
it's getting a bit frustrating out there for Kallis. Four fielders on the ring in the covers, plus a man at short cover. And he can't beat any of them
fuller and wider, but the same result as his attempted cut skews to point
lovely delivery, full and tight to the stumps, Kallis drives at thin air and Carlton Baugh fields with a juggle. Kallis shakes his head in frustration

and there it is! And that is a brilliant, brilliant wicket for West Indies. They've earned that during the past few overs with some good lines from the bowlers and alert fielding in the covers. Kallis loses his composure, has a wipe across the line to a good-length ball, and Ramnaresh Sarwan clings onto a steepling top-edge at third man
Herschelle Gibbs is the new batsman, but he's at the non-striker's end
down the leg-side
better length, pushed onto the back foot. End of a big over for West Indies
full-length on off stump. Pushed into the covers
more tight lines, and another push into the covers. Will Gibbs keep his cool better than Kallis managed?
driven down to mid-off this time
out to the covers again. Lovely composure from the bowler
straighter this time, and turned to midwicket. But still not off the mark
excellent over. And the pressure is turned up another notch
full-length outswinger, extra pace, and that's a careless swing-and-a-miss from Bosman. Not what his team needs
bouncer, perhaps a bit of a harsh call from the umpire
that's a poor delivery. I think it was meant to be the slower ball, but it was misdirected and helped round the corner to backward square-leg
better lines from Bravo. Watchfully negotiated
fuller length and Bosman rocks onto leg stump and drops his wrists to guide the ball to third man. Ungainly but reasonably effective
finally, Gibbs beats the field to get off the mark. It was a poor ball that deserved the treatment - short and wide, and clobbered through the gap in the covers
and a dot ball to finish a good over for South Africa. Bravo's not got his slower ball going yet in this innings
ninety-three now. Pushed out to point
ninety-four. Smith has done well since he entered the attack. Making his lack of pace into a virtue
ninety-five ... you get the picture. Bosman negotiates another ball
misdirected, and pushed down the leg-side again
on the leg-side again, and wafted round the corner with a shovel-pull shot
pushed into the covers and a scampered single. Might have been tight if the cover fielder hadn't fumbled
that's a poor finish. Leg-side full-toss and it's given the treatment. Bosman is doing a good job for his team
placed into space on the off side
Bosman up his toes and drops it a few feet into the off side. Gibbs calls him through for a snappy single
inside edge past the off stump, the ball races down to fine leg where Taylor makes a sprawling stop and his throw clatters into the stumps for good measure
Gibbs gets everything behind that
wide and a rasping drive through extra cover to the man in the deep
Bosman does well to run that down to third man. It was closer to him than he might have liked but he controlled the shot admirably
driven to extra cover. Bosman had to really wait for that to arrive
again he waited and punched that to deep mid on
Gibbs shaped to turn that to leg and it appeared to come off the back of the bat!
Gayle on the spot, Gibbs defends
Gibbs tries a straight drive but Gayle scampers across and stops the ball with his foot
too short and Gibbs has time to rock back and smash that through the covers. Four all the way and Gayle grimaces in annoyance
poor start, too wide and Bosman smacks that through extra cover forcing Sarwan to make a diving, sliding stop on the rope
pushed through and Bosman blocks

the bowling change works!  Bosman tried to flick the ball into the leg side, caught a leading edge and it gently looped to Gayle at extra cover. Another much-needed breakthrough as Bosman had overcome his poor start and was beginning to cut loose
a confident start ... he steps forward and paddles the ball square on the leg side
Samuels again ups the pace and that is enough to force the batsman to think
turned to leg where the fielder is quick to run in ... but he runs over it and the batsmen are able to amble a single
Gayle on the spot
Gayle continues to strangle the life out of de Villiers
driven straight and this time a tumbling Gayle cannot stop it
Gibbs aims to turn to leg but doesn't time it
driven staright to the fielder. Gayle races through these overs ... the TV companies hate it as they can't run adverts as the fielders race between overs and it makes commentary hard as well!
Samuels finds the right spot
pushed through and de Villiers misses as he tries to run it to third man
patted back to the bowler
blocked once more. Now Samuels racing through the overs
slightly leg side but not timed
driven up to long on
ruu up to long on for an easy one
waited and pulled with venom but staright to the man at midwicket
steps down the track and pushed to long on
fuller length beat him on the back foot
much the same but this time he was beatne on the front foot!
de Villiers connects at the third time of asking and strolls a single as he plops the ball down the ground
too much width and carved through point
too wide but unable to find the gapo in the covers
and the same again
looks to drive off the back foot and gets a definite edge ... the ball flies off Baugh's elbow down to third man
pushed to midwicket
full length and shovelled to long on
Waits and flicks the ball wide of midwicket
slapped up to mid on
shorter and a checked-pull to midwicket
leg-side drive and a tumbling Gayle doesn't stop cleanly
patted back to the bowler
short and heaved over cow corner where it bounces about six inches short of the rope
Gibbs waits and flicks it to long on
de Villiers squats to cut the ball and is surprised by the bounce
worked into space on the off
leisurely drive down the ground
neatly turned into space once again
good length, turned to midwicket
Chinese cut for one. Hard to set a field to that!
into space. The spinners are doing a good job here
Gibbs flicks to midwicket
de Villiers repeats the stroke
Gibbs turns it to leg and this time the batsmen had to scramble to make it home
solid defensive shot, patted back to the bowler
leg-side, and turned to backward-square
cuffed down the ground, deflected by the bowler to mid-on
turned to midwicket, who is being kept very busy at the moment
firm drive down to the deep cover boundary
turned into the leg-side again. It's ones and twos all the way for South Africa at the moment. These spinners are doing an excellent job
full and speared into the legs. Pushed into the leg-side
misdirected, and that one goes down the leg-side
fuller length, better length
yorker, and well dug out. Taylor has been a star in this tournament
solid stuff from Taylor. He's a wicket-taker, but he's a tight line-and-length merchant as well
driven firmly down to long-off, but still South Africa are dealing in singles
slower ball, well directed, turned to midwicket
flick of the wrists to turn the ball into the leg-side
so nearly a wicket! de Villiers goes for the big heave-ho, but the ball lands just short of the man at cow corner. Frustration is showing
more watchful from Gibbs
lovely tight lines, and good variation of pace
one more, turned to leg
speared down the leg-side
and another single completes another tidy over
a shade too full, and whipped behind square on the leg-side
width, and a full swing of the shoulders outside off. But still there's no boundary as Dwayne Smith fields on the rope. Thirty-two balls now since the last four
just a single this time as the ball is pushed into the off side
outside off but fuller, mistimed square drive
full and tight to off stump, half-hearted drive, fielded at mid-off
nicely timed on-drive, skips across the turf, but Sarwan in the deep fields well to cut off the boundary
turned to the leg-side again
lovely flight, no chances being taken
turned into the leg-side but midwicket's on hand
driven down to long-off
more singles here than in a lonely hearts column
flicked off the pads, thought about a run but quickly thought again. Lovely bowling
driven down to long-off
appeal from Gayle, but no-one else is interested. Not sure why - that looked rather adjacent!
another turn to midwicket, another run
driven into the covers, and the score ticks up again. I'd be tempted to say this is getting monotonous, but it's actually grimly fascinating
good length, defended
and another flick to midwicket
driven, but fielded by the bowler
out to midwicket again, lovely flight
eased into the leg-side, and whaddaya know, it's another single!
who's going to break first? I wonder ...
not Gibbs, well, not yet anyway
nor de Villiers. Solid stuff from the Boks. Almost too solid in places
short, and flogged through cow corner for a welcome boundary! That's a novelty! The first since about the second over ... ok, maybe I exaggerate a touch
turned to midwicket
props forward
turned away for another single
another dot. It's a touch soporific out there
leg-side, cannoned off pads into the covers
flicked into the deep
a chance! And a boundary! Filthy heave across the line from Gibbs, and an under-edge goes straight through Baugh's legs and away to the boundary. Streaky but effective!
misdirected follow-up, fielded at fine leg
pushed into the covers
a feisty flog into the off-side, but fielded inside the rope
another single.
and another. Just to clarify to Mr Graham Fish, who thinks I'm being biased against his beloved South Africans, I'm not. Honest. But there's only so many ways to describe a single
ooh look, there's another
but that's a four, and in some style too! Over-pitched and launched over the covers for a very welcome boundary. And that's Gibbs's fifty. Well played that man
turned to midwicket
and another single to finish
long hop, cracked inches over the leaping grasp of midwicket and on to the ropes
de Villiers again finds the space. Bradshaw has struggled all day and is doing so again

de Villiers, cramped as Bradshaw fires one at his feet, squirts it into the leg side and Lara at midwicket scores a direct hit with one-and-a-half stumps to aim at. The third umpire has to work hard. It takes several replays before he makes his call. From one angle he appears in, from another out. Andrew Miller screams out ... and Daryl Harper agrees!
full length, driven to deep mid off. Gibbs wanted two but Kemp, running to the danger end, was having none of it
Kemp watches that pass oustdie off stump. The calm after the storm
Kemp runs that down to third man to get off the mark
patted back to the bowler
flicked into the leg side but straight to Lara
this time Kemp goes squarer with his placement and finds the space
Gibbs finds the same gap with the same stroke
patted past the man at extra cover for an ambled single to the man on the rope
Gibbs works the ball to leg. Gayle will be happy with this. Stopping boundaries the order of the day from here on in
full toss, bashed to long off
Bradshaw breaks through. Nothing complex about that, it came back a fraction, Kemp played down the wrong line and it bowled him through a rather-too-large gap between bat and pad
off the mark with a confident flick to long leg
Boucher gives Bradshaw the charge, heaving the ball into the leg side where the man on the deep-square boundary fields
even slower ball (66mph) which Boucher shapes to run to third man but he misses. Neat take by Baugh
Gayle back to continue his strangulation of the innings
Gayle strays down the leg ... a rare aberration
Gibbs works the ball into the covers
Gibbs misses an attempted paddle to leg
flicked to the left of midwicket, slightly off balance, and although they run the first quickly there is no chance of a second
driven even straighter into a leg-side gap
square drive and nicely placed to allow an easy two to the man in the deep
confident drive through extra cover but the man two-thirds back is in the right place
squeezed backward of point
pitched up, Boucher can do no more than drive straight down the ground. He scurries the first run quickly but no chance of a second this time
crisp straight drive, past the stumps and Aleem Dar takes evasive action like a man auditioning for Strictly Come Dancing as the ball races to the ropes
into the leg side where Lara misfields
Maximum!  Boucher waits for that and hammers it off one knee over cow corner and beyond

short, Boucher looked to smack it straight but it sounded as if he might have clipped the ground as he brought his bat through and the ball flew high into the covers where Sarwan took a good catch over his shoulder
placed all the way to long on
Pollock wastes no time, hammering the ball through the covers
Pollock waits and angles the ball wide of extra cover
Gibbs fails to find the gap ... a rare dot ball at this stage
semi-lofted drive to long on
splodded to third man
well bowled and well played. Gibbs looked to give himself room and Taylor followed, spearing it in at the batsman's feet and he could only squirt it into the leg side
it was straight, it was pitched up, and it was missed by the batsman. Pollock had to go for it and doing so against Taylor when he is on song is a tough ask
squirted wide of backward point and the two men in the deep combine to semi-stop it on the rope. The umpire asks if it was four, the fielders shrug ... but the third umpire is in no doubt
full toss which is worked square through the covers
gentle start allowing Peterson to work a single
Gibbs is hit on the pads standing well outside the leg stump and the ball plops into the off side
full toss, smeared off the back foot and Morton makes a great stop at backward point as the ball bounces inches in front of him. Peterson stares at the umpire ... that was almost above his waist
turned to backward leg
slower ball, hammered into the leg side, and Gibbs was gone had Lara at midwicket hit with his throw ... but he missed by some distance
right up in the blockhole and Peterson squirts it into the leg side
Slower ball which Peterson shapes to cut but it was far too full and he ends up missing it
steered into the covers
Gibbs leans back and thwacks that straight down the ground ... long off can only watch and wait for someone in row Z to return it to him
Taylor responds by cramping Gibbs and limiting him to a more sedate single
wide of off stump and Peterson misses with his attempted slash. It might be late on but that was still 88mph
driven to deepish and widish long off where Dwayne Smith makes a right horlicks of picking it up and they run a second
how odd. Bravo tried a slower/fuller/doosra or something like that and it flew down the leg side, beyond everyone and trundled to the ropes
sanity returns with a better ball and a single
another slower ball, this time in the right spot, and Peterson spoons it over the infield on the off
pitched up inn the blockhole, driven back with interest and Bravo athletically stoops and makes a nonchalant one-handed stop
yet another slower ball which Gibbs looks to send towards the city centre but he catches it high on the bat and Lara is under the skier half-a-dozen yards in at long on
plopped no more than a yard down the pitch and batsman beats bowler in the race that ensues

the slowest ball of the day - almost Gayle pace - and Nel, who completed his heave before the ball was halfway through its flight, missed it. Peterson, who almost overtook it, ran the bye and Nel scrambled home at the other end

inn2.comm: oops ... that's not the ideal start. Too short and wide and West Indies are off the mark
cracking strike! Short and straighter, and flat-batted straight back past the bowler. Pollock hasn't got the pace of old, and needs to be right on the money. That time, he wasn't.
even better shot! The last one was a smear, this one was eased down the ground. Too straight for mid-off to cut off
better - straighter, fuller, and left alone
solidly into line and pushed down the pitch
tried a big heave into the leg-side, but not timed
good finish to the over from Pollock, as Gayle swings and misses at a length delivery, just outside off. But that's a flying start for West Indies
good start, pitches middle-and-leg, defended
beauty! That's the spot. Had to play at it, but burst past the outside edge. Big oohs from the slip cordon
on the money again, but met with a full face this time&
steps across the stumps, flicks off the thigh
firm back-foot drive through the gap in the covers. Gayle is looking belligerent so far
good finish from Ntini, on that middle-and-leg line again, angled across, met with a respectful defensive push
short and punched back down the pitch, fielded one-handed in Ntini's followthrough
outside off stump, left alone. Pollock scratches his footholes
solid start to this over from Pollock.
wicket-to-wicket, and Chanderpaul is squared up as he defends. But then, he's always squared up, so that's no great news
outside off, and dabbed down to fine leg. Shiv is off the mark
a touch too short, but Gayle - swinging off the back foot - can't reach the boundary
dabbed to third man again
leg-stump line, turned to square leg
outside off, and Chanderpaul plants a firm front foot and squirts another single to deep backward point
shorter, and Gayle is up on his toes, playing straight back down the ground
on the pads, and worked straight to the fielder at square leg
lovely delivery! Extra bounce and bursts off the shoulder of the bat, eluding the two men in the cordon. Well bowled
beautiful measured drive from Chanderpaul to complete the over. That was in his slot, and he cashed in
good length, seemed to keep low as Gayle played off the back foot, but then he is quite tall. Fielded at short cover
whumph! That went like an absolute bat out of hell, driven straight as a die down the ground. You can't bowl there to Gayle
that's better, but another single as Gayle picks the gap in the covers
there's so little margin for error for Pollock, but he gets it right this time as cover fields
outside off, and eased through the gap in the covers. No great power or timing, but the placement was perfect
slower ball to finish the over, and Chanderpaul was nearly suckered. Had to check his stroke, but did so effectively
lovely strike! Strays too far onto the pads and clipped with power through midwicket! Gayle, a centurion against England, is on song again
good batting, rotates the strike with a measured push into space
short, and worked round the corner with a swivelled pull off the back foot. Finding the gaps again
stunning strike. Easy as you like, straight through the covers. Excellent batting
slight misfield in the covers allows Chanderpaul to pass 6000 runs in ODI cricket. Excellent work sir!
two more to the total, as deep square leg tidies up. Very productive over for West Indies, and problems for Graeme Smith
wham! A full swing through the line, one bounce just inside the rope behind the bowler's head. More abuse for Pollock's figures!
better length again, but the boundaries just keep on coming
whipped into the leg-side, but no way through there
on the legs, flicked down to deep fine leg where Ntini fields
on the legs again, Gayle into position early, waited for it, and picked his spot through midwicket
fuller length, and a slight misjudgment from Gayle, who had grand designs for that shot but only inside-edged onto his pads
short and smeared through midwicket! That was a loosener that South Africa could ill afford. No foot movement from Chanderpaul, just a free swing of the bat. Thrilling stuff!
misdirected again, and that's six runs off the over already. South Africa haven't gauged the pace of this pitch yet
outside off and carved backward of point
bouncer! Well directed and Chanderpaul turns turtle. A real effort ball
whipped through midwicket again, excellent placement and that's ten off the over
splat! Hardly bothered to move, and crunched up and over long-off for a maximum! Is that faith misplaced?
shorter, but a slower ball. Gayle watches it off the pitch and pushes into the covers
leg-side, and turned to midwicket
great placement again, picked the gap on the offside and back for a couple
better length, respectfully played. No need for risks for West Indies
and a good finish to the over, wicket-to-wicket, and pushed back down the track
turned into the leg-side
glorious! Steps outside the line of off stump, and a beautiful pick-up-and-deposit over backward-square leg for another maximum!
good riposte, but Nel is fuming
a pause for breath
still round the wicket, outside off, dabbed to third man, and the runs keep on flowing
banged in, and Gayle goes for the big heave, but connects only with air. Another productive over for West Indies
comes forward and prods it into the covers, without great timing, but it's well-placed and they scamper a single
comes forward with a lunge, defending it solidly
rapped on the pads, Boucher goes ballistic behind the stumps but it's miles outside the line
Gayle takes a heave at this but can't time it and Smith leaps across to field. He does well too
solidly defended once more
slightly shorter allowing Gayle to rock back, who times it into the covers
rocks back and cuts this behind square to third man. Too wide from Nel
power! It wasn't even that short from Nel who corrected his line, but Gayle slapped it over midwicket for a resounding four
pushed into the covers
quicker, angling across the left-hander who deftly opens the blade and runs it down to a wide third man
much better, fuller and straighter - quick, too - forcing Gayle to block it out which he does without alarm
short, pulled by Gayle but for once he can't time it and it's hit straight to mid-on
angling into Chanderpaul's pads before turning away, the batsmen nudging it back to the bowler
a touch wider allowing the left-hander to drive it flowingly through the covers, but without much timing
what a shot! Straighter and quicker from Smith, Gayle reverse-sweeps it down past third man for four
this is quite brilliant batting. Smith adjusts his line, but so does Gayle and he drills it down the ground. No one moved
pushed into the gap on the off side for a single
well bowled on Chanderpaul's middle stump, slower too, but the batsman simply turns his wrists and grabs a single
and he starts nicely with a straight, full delivery which Chanderpaul pushes back to the bowler
ooh, angles this across the left-hander who injudiciously tries to angle it down to third man, misses...
too wide from Kallis but he escapes conceding a boundary as Chanderpaul's cut finds point
shorter and quicker, he tries to pull it but can't time it...hit back to the bowler meekly
good line this time outside his off stump, Chanderpaul rocks back and times it with a pleasing clunk of the bat but straight to cover
oooh, quicker and it almost sneaks through. Well, it would have had Kallis bowled it straight...it hurries Chanderpaul who nudges it around the corner
pushed back to Smith who fields to his right
too straight allowing the batsman to work it on the leg-side for an easy single
clubbed back to the bowler
well bowled! Much quicker, Boucher says "ohh" and Gayle says nothing after his attempted cut made him look a bit daft
pushed into the covers
nicely bowled but solidly defended
swing and a miss from Gayle who threw everything at this wider delivery outside his off stump
well bowled again, fuller and quicker on Gayle's off-stump who went back to defend. Beautifully timed, though, if you catch my meaning
and Gayle tries to hammer this through the covers but it's just a touch too short, preventing him from timing it and it bobbles out into the infield
that's very nicely bowled on Gayle's leg stump, showing just a hint of swing away from the left-hander
pushed back past Kallis to long-off for a single and there's his fifty, from 48 balls - his 29th in one-dayers. A fine, fine innings
attempted cut but no timing there
confidently pushed into the covers
wide of Gayle's leg stump who stands tall, turning it behind square but there's a short fine-leg alurkin' to prevent the single
pushed into the covers
neatly turned with a flick of the wrists to square-leg
without moving his feet, it's pushed out into the covers
defended off the back foot with the straightest of bats, but it's a no-ball from Kallis. Smith looks worried...
oh, shot! As Boycott might say, "Shot, boy, shot" as Gayle rocks back to pull a shorter delivery over midwicket for a massive six. Bosh indeed
even better! A quite remarkable shot, standing tall and driving it past Kallis's right hand. Long-off didn't stand a chance and it torpedoed for four
more power from Gayle but straight to mid-off this time
pushed off his legs, crab-like.
pushed out into the covers, again no timing
tries to sweep this but misses out, for once. Had he made contact, that was sailing into the Indian ocean
skips down the pitch to meet a shorter delivery and chips it into the covers
angled down to third-man
turned off his legs, but without much timing
just a single - Smith's doing really well here - chipping it down to long-on
slunked back to the bowler off the back foot
far too short and somehow he gets away with it, Gayle no doubt surprised and he can't do anything with it
boshed back to the bowler
cor, another bosh from Gayle smacking it back to the bowler who dives, gets a hand to it and stops it from denting the boundary boards

Chanderpaul lunges forward, turns his wrists and places it beautifully to pick up another single. And there's his 42nd one-day fifty - a fine innings, playing the perfect counterfoil to the Gayle hurricane (sorry)
defended on the front foot
down the track and meets it on the full, fielded at midwicket
pushed down the ground and fielded by the bowler
worked into the gap, another one notched up
steady work from the spinners. They've added a sense of decorum after the earlier fireworks
rocks onto the back foot, but can't beat the field
good line and length, worked back down the pitch
strays onto the pads and another run notched up on the leg side
That ... Is ... Vast! Massive stride down the pitch, huge heave through the line and that has sailed way, way into the night sky. Gayle is in brutal touch!
good cricket. The big squat, followed by the little dab
Chanderpaul responds in kind, but he's definitely limping
picks the gap on the leg-side, and another productive over is completed. South Africa have it all to do
tickled fine on the leg-side, and that's a scampered single
just trading the strike at the moment, these two. As well they might
another quarter of a boundary accumulated
and another one. Chanderpaul steps out of his crease to turn this into a full-toss
good flight, lands on a good length. Respectfully played
good finish to a good over. But West Indies are cruising at present
nothing wrong with the delivery, but well met with an angled blade, and another good quick single, to bring Mr Belligerent back on strike
worked into the leg-side
biding his time ... you can sense the power that he's having to rein in
there he goes! Slightly off-line, and pummelled through the leg-side, all the way to the ropes. There's no stopping him at the moment
back in his box once again. He's done the hard work for this over
and dinked into the gap to complete the over. All very easy
round the wicket, and worked into space on the leg-side
on the pads again, missed out, but gets the deflection anyway
great cricket! A massive biff from Gayle, but Ntini at mid-on leapt like a rampant salmon to cut off a certain boundary. Well done Makhaya
pushed out to cover
showing no ill-effects, Chanderpaul pushes this one to point, and that completes an elongated over
played into the leg-side
bang! An attempted slower ball, and Gayle is onto it with a murderous swing of the blade. Another boundary to the tally!
attempted similar, but under-edged
bouncer, and perhaps a rather harsh call of wide. Kallis wasn't impressed!
much better ball, good line and length, Gayle is slightly squared up as he pushes it back down the pitch
solidly into line
even Gayle's streaky shots are finding the boundary! A massive heave through the offside, but an under-edge goes through to fine leg!
good line and length to the new batsman, pushed back down the pitch
strays in line, deflects down the leg-side
on the back foot, punched to cover
yorker, well directed, and very well dug out. That might have done for a newer batsman
outside off stump, steered into the covers with minimal footwork
impeccable timing! Rocked onto the front foot, rode the bounce and whipped through midwicket. It's another boundary and Sarwan is off the mark in glorious style!
better line and length from Kallis
wider outside off, but Sarwan misses with a cross-batted swish
glorious. Another vicious crosscourt whip, and Kallis holds his head in despair
back on a good line and length to finish the over, but the damage in this over has been done. South Africa are looking bereft in the field
extraordinary! That was more of a front-foot sweep shot straight through mid-on! "A baseball slug" suggest the Sky commentators. Let your imagination join the dots
slower ball to follow that up. Clever bowling
watchful this time. Again, he's got his runs early in the over, but Nel's not giving up
played square of the wicket off the back foot, but can't beat the field
pinged him! That was an excellent bouncer, and Gayle lost sight of it completely. Turned his head and paid the price as his helmet was badly rattled. Good aggression from Nel
a bit of an ungainly smear, and one hand comes off the bat as he does so. Perhaps he's more rattled than he initially looked
good length to start, Sarwan is squared up but plays with a straight bat
flicked into the deep to return the strike
very wide of the crease from Ntini, but Sarwan picks the change of angle and plays uppishly and over point for four!
tighter to the stumps, and played into the off side
good stride down the pitch, played back to the bowler
wide of the crease again, and pushed into the covers.
solidly defended on the back foot
turned around the corner to square leg, no great timing there
and that rather sums up the situation of this match. A perfectly reasonable delivery outside his offstump, and Sarwan simply leant back and creamed it through the covers. Glorious
the bouncer! Sarwan cries "yipe," or words to the effect of, as Nel sends in a very quick bouncer which followed him and the batsman ducked underneath. Good aggressive intent from Nel
quicker still, shorter still, and Sarwan goes for an almighty hook, misses, and the ball flies through to Boucher. That was pacey and Nel, dripping in sweat, casts an angry glance at the batsman
too wide down the leg side, and called as such
quicker and straighter, Gayle bunts it off his legs with ease
straight and full, Gayle defends it out into the off-side and he thinks about a single but Sarwan rightly sends him back. Nervy-nineties!
very well bowled angling it across the left-hander but he'll have to wait another ball for his hundred
defended once more! This is good bowling from Ntini

and there it is! What a fantastic hundred and it's celebrated in true Gayle-style, whooping it up and Catherine-wheeling his arms a couple of times. His 15th one-day hundred and one of his better ones, too. Well done that man.
nicely bowled outside Sarwan's off-stump, touch more bounce there which hits the splice of his bat. Nevertheless it's well played off the back foot
well bowled; full, straight and quick, Sarwan is forced to defend his stumps
good grief, what happened there? A shorter delivery and Sarwan comes down the pitch, trying to pull it,  and bottom-edges it ungainly. No need for such aggression whatsoever...
a scampered single
digs this into Gayle who pulls it, but without any timing or power
attempted yorker from Nel - good thinking but it turned out to be a half-volley allowing Sarwan to chip it to the leg side
squared up by a good delivery outside his off stump and squirted out into the off side
fuller and straighter, swinging into the right hander. Sarwan, without moving his feet, climbs into it and drives it through the covers all along the turf. Fabulously timed.
squirted out onto the off side
turned off his legs
lovely shot! He simply rocked back and turned it off his legs, using the pace of the delivery to send it fine for four

gone! Sarwan rather fell over to a full-pitched delivery, swinging into Sarwan and angling further into his pads off the pitch. Ntini roars an appeal and it's been given...a touch fortunate, perhaps? Appeared to be angling down the leg side but, no, replays indicate it was a mighty splendid decision.
wild! Wild and woolly down the leg side
quicker (83.9mph) and right on Bravo's off stump who watchfully comes forward, presenting the straightest of bats
glorious, a lovely cut with a real Caribbean flourish, hammering it past backward point for four. Sumptuous
and he loses his line here, angling it down the leg side to allow a quick single
pushed off his pads for another single
Defended solidly
Gayle misses out here. Wide of his off stump he could've carved it through the covers but instead found the fielder at extra cover
a full-bunger from Ntini which takes Gayle by surprise, and he mistimes it down the ground for a single
that's more like it, and there's another double-teapot from Smith. Bravo leans back and drives over the top, over extra cover for four. Shot.
good comeback from the bowler cutting it back into the right-hander who jabs down on it, but can't steal a single
shorter, Bravo pulls it - taking his eye off the ball, too, and jerking his head to one side - and, as such, doesn't time it as well as he might
clunked off the back foot but straight to mid-off
oh that's got to hurt. Rubbish from Nel, sending it down the leg side and Bravo just gets a thin edge and it races down for four.
a flourishing drive off the back foot finds the fielder at point
oh what a cracker from Nel who induces a play-and-miss from Gayle - his first, I think, of his entire innings.
strays down the leg side, Gayle gets inside the line and tickles it fine for four more! Poor over
much better line from Nel, outside Gayle's off stump - that's where they should be bowling - and Gayle is forced into a backward defensive
down the leg side once more. Nel is all over the place here, but you cannot deny or underestimate his commitment
another extraordinary shot! Angled into Gayle who pushes at it, seemingly innocuously, hitting Bravo the non-striker before racing past him for four. Pure timing
comes forward to defend, squirting it to the leg side and they steal another single.
again they pick up a single, Gayle nudging it to the leg side where a rather complacent bit of fielding allows them yet another run
he skips down the pitch but is beaten by the spin, the ball coming off his pad and ballooning to Graeme Smith at first slip who throws down the stumps and Bravo's dive is in vain. Utterly unnecessary
comes forward and defends
and again he comes forward, but allows this non-turning delivery to pass by
chipped to the leg-stump
too short, Lara turns it off his pads for a single
rapped on the pads, nicely bowled - quicker, too
massive, raucous, throaty (not to mention rather loud) appeal from Boucher to one which rapped Gayle's pads but he was outside the line.
short and wide, clubbed into the covers
clever paddle-cum-sweep-cum-clunk down to fine-leg. Too wide from Smith, and Gayle is too good not to miss out. Smith looks a finished man
full toss which Gayle times through midwicket, brilliantly, but the sweeper on the boundary cuts off a certain four with some athletic
boshed out to the off side
pushed out into the off side
lovely shot off the back foot clubbing it down to long-off
beautiful, down on one knee and just angled past third man for four. Fabulous shot, and his 1000th four in one-dayers
elegantly chipped down the ground
looped up to leg stump, turned away
short of a length, punched off the back foot
respectfully forward
gosh, now that's a surprise! Smith has got the big man! Another loopy delivery, and a loose drive is embedded in the bowler's midriff
pushed into the covers
turned to midwicket, to end a very useful over. Too little too late? Probably ...
turned phlegmatically into the gap on the leg-side. Gayle wants to finish this himself
nice flight and loop, pushed back down the track
tight bowling so far this over ... I sense there may be some flutters to come

good grief, that is village! Gayle is cruising at the other end, but Morton wanted to finish the job himself, but instead his big smear ends up in the hands of short midwicket. Brainless batting, I'm afraid to say, and it was somewhat telegraphed
good length, met with a deliberate dead bat

the end of another very useful over. Spin, as Viv Richards once said (apparently) is a useful setting on a washing-machine. It's also useful for putting the heebie-jeebies through a West Indian batting line-up
poor ball, and Gayle swings that one round the corner and away to the midwicket boundary. He's still in control, and therefore so are the Windies
tickled away to fine leg
sensible defence
shuffles across his stumps, and pushed back down the track
that will help the cause! Opens the blade and punches behind square for a welcome boundary to get off the mark
and that's a useful addition. Gayle keeps the strike, with just four runs needed
flicked off the pads, but straight to the fielder
shorter, and bludgeoned down the ground. But the long-on sweeper tidies up
stretching forward and smothers the spin, not that there's a whole lot of it
tip-and-run cricket, and a scampered single ends with a direct hit from the covers, but the batsmen are home
oops, that's a bonus
driven, but straight to the man at mid-off
brilliant. Full stride, and clobbered down the ground for the winning boundary
